: : Darkangel : :
Darkangel: Yes, right away, sir.
Darkangel started working on a computer panel. He sent a read out to all decks, informing them to saty clear of the plagued continent. He then sent the armed probes to the other bases.
Darkangel: Sir, DeathSteel is still waiting to meet you.
 Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote:Tyrael looked on the northern continent and a label indicating a
disease unscrolled halfway between Maximal and Predacon base. The
puzzled look of the phoenix revealed that he did not know more about it.

Tyrael: Computer, is analysis of the disease possible at this distance?

Computer: Partly. Analysis of the nature is impossible due to lack of
smaple. Propagation analysis possible. Three concordant disease found:
the Hypello Flu, the Terran Small Pox and the Cosmic Rust.

His eyes widened at the mention of the last disease. That was the real
threat.

Tyrael: Darkangel, I want no one to operate on the Northern Continent
until we know that Plague has been eradicated. In fact, this worries
me so much that I consider leaving to go in orbit. We need to know
though... Send spy drone near both bases and another one at the Rogues
and include some fusion bomb on them so we can destroy the drones
should they get infected.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> 
> : : Darkangel : :
> He finds the nearest computer panel, and hits a few buttons. The
world map comes up in 3d.
> Darkangel: Here we are...
>  Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:Tyrael nodded.
> 
> Tyrael: Computer, medical program. Attend to Dreadplague.
> 
> On both sides of the surgery table, small nanotech instruments came
> out and went at work on the Harpoon located in Dreadplague's belly.
> She had stopped complaining and she was in a shutdown state.
> 
> Tyrael: Now, Darkangel, let's take a look at the situation.
> 
> He picked Kaiser up and got him in a CR.
> 
> Tyrael: Can you bring up the world map?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> > 
> > : : Darkangel : :
> > Darkangel attatches two circuits to Dreadplague. One on her spine
> and one on her forehead.
> > Darkangel: Set, commander.
> >  Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:Not waiting, the Trpredacus leader
> takes the pain reliefs out of
> > Darkangel's hands and injects them just beside the wound. Dreadplague
> > heavy twitching stops a few nanocycles after.
> > 
> > Tyrael: Good. That will make it easier. Prometheus, is Epimetheus
in CR?
> > 
> > He takes one of the support circuits and peels off the sterilization
> > plastic strip on its back, then sticks it along Dread's spine.
> > 
> > Tyrael: Now, Darkangel, put two more circuits on her; one on her
> > spine, the other on her forehead. They will at least keep her
> > stabilized for them moment.
> > 
> > : : Darkangel : : 
> > 
> > He rushes off, looking through the lab for what is need. He eventually
> > returns with what was asked for. 
> > 
> > Darkangel: Here it is... 
> > 
> > Azure The Warrior <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote: 
> > 
> > Tyrael touched the harpoon but a gasp from the female made him take
> > his hands off.
> > 
> > Tyrael: Not genetically speaking, but she considers me as her father
> > because I created her. Please go get some pain reliefs and a life
> > support circuit system.
> > 
> > He placed Dread better on the table, lying her on her back and
> > installing her head on a damage control pad.
> > 
> > Tyrael: Destructor, Prometheus, take Kaiser and Epimetheus to the CR.
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > >From: Richard Allen 
> > >To: Nic 
> > >Subject: Re: Fwd: Return to the base (Prometheus) 
> > >Date: Wed, 5 Mar 2003 17:10:36 -0800 (PST) 
> > > 
> > > 
> > >: : Darkangel : : 
> > >Darkangel: I see. This planet is full of warriors. Actually we have a
> > new member who I brought in. He is waiting in his quarters. 
> > >Darkangel seemed a little nervous to ask his next question. 
> > >Darkangel: I hope Dreadplague is ok. If you dont mind, is she really
> > your daughter? 
> > > Nic wrote: OOC: I just changed my email address for Yahoogroups.
> > It's now 
> > >Proudwing500k@h... 
> > > 
> > >Bic: 
> > > 
> > >Tyrael looked at him while examining Dread's wound. 
> > > 
> > >Tyrael: We ran in the Rogues. Fierce warriors, but just a little bit 
> > >misguided and chaotic. (He turns to Prometheus) Can you tend to
her or 
> > >can your brother do it? 
> > > 
> > >--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen wrote: 
> > > > 
> > > > : : Darkangel : : 
> > > > Darkangel meets up with the other bots. 
> > > > Darkangel: My god, what happened? I dont know much medical
skills, 
> > >only the basics taught in millitary schools. 
> > > > Azure The Warrior wrote:From: "Azure The 
> > >Warrior" 
> > > > To: roborick007@y... 
> > > > Subject: Return to the base 
> > > > Date: Wed, 05 Mar 2003 01:33:53 +0000 
> > > > 
> > > > OOC: Hey Robo, it seems like Yahoogroups doesn't want me to post. 
> > >Could you transfer this to the group? Thanx! Bic: Tyrael landed
in the 
> > >small hatch on the side of the Tripredacus Warship and went straight 
> > >to the CR chambers and the medbay. Tyrael: Prometheus, Destructor, 
> > >please follow me. We'll get them to CR then plan our next moves. (He 
> > >opened a comm with Darkangel) Darkangel, are you trained in any form 
> > >of medical interventions? He enters the room and places
Dreadplague's 
> > >pain-twisted body on a table. He was worried by the harpoon still 
> > >deeply anchored in her body and did not dare to remove it. He
knew it 
> > >had to be out before she went in a CR or she would have disastrous 
> > >side effects after. Tyrael: Do any of you know something in medical 
> > >interventions? 
> >
